title: Fashion logo fonts?
content:
Hi Guys,

Please could someone ID these logos?

Thanks in advance  
Rick

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 4.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%204_40.png) | 28.18 KB |
| [Picture 5.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%205_39.png) | 21.62 KB |
| [Picture 6.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%206_28.png) | 17.09 KB |
author: rtgbanks

comments.content:
Picture 5 looks like [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/avenir/) or [House Neutraface No.2](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/collections/neutraface).

- Mike Yanega

Picture 6 looks like [House Chalet Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20130721001812/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chaletbook), with the R from House Neutraface No. 2.

- Mike Yanega
Hi Mike, thanks for the comments. I don't think it's either Avenir or Neutraface...the K is off and S are off.

This is interesting. To me, it looks like they are borrowing letters from Avant Garde demi and Gotham medium, but some widths seems a bit off. I bet there is a bit of stretching of letters. The C in 5 looks like Gotham while in 6 looks like Avant Garde.

Yeah I know Paul, the C is definitely Avant Garde looking!

It's a very strange one!
